titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Linonian Society, Yale College, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:06

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, secretary's records, treasurer's records, and librarian's records documenting society activities, membership, financial affairs, the society's founding, book collections, and other relevant activities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Linonian Society, Yale College, Records (RU 206). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Linonian Literary Society was founded in 1753. All undergraduates were allowed to be members of the Linonian Society. The club provided students with a forum to debate, stage plays, and deliver poems, essays, and orations. The society disbanded in 1868.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, secretary"s records, treasurer's records, and librarian's records documenting society activities, membership, financial affairs, the society's founding, book collections, and other relevant activities.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 40 (YRG 40), Records of Yale clubs, societies, and organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged in four series: I. General Correspondence. II. Secretary's Records. III. Treasurer"s Records. IV. Librarian's Records; and subsequent accessions.
